qas.question: Where did Spectre filming take place after Rome?
Which celebration was featured in the Mexico City part of the production?
Which areas were shown in the Day of the Dead scene in Spectre?

answers.text: the Zócalo and the Centro Histórico district

qas.question: How many additional actors were needed for the shoot in Mexico City?
Where were the scenes featuring planes shot?
What festival was included in the scenes shot in Mexico?

answers.text: the Day of the Dead festival

qas.question: What type of helicopter was used for the flight scenes?
Where in Mexico were the Day of the Dead scenes shot?

answers.text: Zócalo and the Centro Histórico district

qas.question: Filming moved to which city in late May?
In which city was the film's closing sequence filmed?
What was closed in order to film a fight sequence using a boat?
The scene in which square required about 2,500 extras?

context: With filming completed in Rome, production moved to <a0_0><b8_0><b9_0>Mexico<b9_0/><b8_0/> City<a0_0/> in late March to shoot the film's opening sequence, with scenes to include <a5_0>the <a1_0>Day of the Dead<a1_0/> festival<a5_0/> filmed in and around <a2_0>the <a7_0>Zócalo and the Centro Histórico district<a7_0/><a2_0/>. The planned scenes required the <b10_0><b11_0>city<b11_0/> square<b10_0/> to be closed for filming a sequence involving a fight aboard <a6_0>a Messerschmitt-Bölkow-Blohm Bo 105 helicopter<a6_0/> flown by stunt pilot Chuck Aaron, which called for modifications to be made to several buildings to prevent damage. This particular scene in Mexico required <a3_0>1,500<a3_0/> extras, 10 giant skeletons and 250,000 paper flowers. Reports in the Mexican media added that the film's second unit would move to <a4_0>Palenque<a4_0/> in the state of Chiapas, to film aerial manoeuvres considered too dangerous to shoot in an urban area.
